Wow Go figure?

So, I felt a bit...on the melee side, sadly I haven't much experience on it. The problem I face is... I don't really know how to go about this. I play on Arelith lv 30, now here's what I imagine.


I imagine a rogue would do great for a starter base as an assassin (seeing as how they both benefit from sneak attacks, dex, etc. Outside of that... I'm a tad clueless xD

I would imagine the best weapons would be daggers or shortswords (although, I'm open to other suggestions, katanas are dual wieldable and finessable and such), but I have no idea a good weapon

What I'd like to be able to do is have a good heal skill, lockpicking, hiding, trap related, assassin/rogue type things. It's mostly for pvp, I guess, but being able to survive pve would be nice as well (since I do gotta level and other stuff) ^^ 

Shadowdancer level 5, might be a good idea...for hide in plain sight, but otherwise, I'm unsure.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Hi
Here is something I have come up with that as far as I know follow the Arelith rules. There are two gifts for +2 int and +2 dex.
I am not quite sure what skill targets that make sense on Arelith. I have maxed stealth. I don't know if you will need a maxed open lock or not. The trap skills are high enough to detect, recover and set most vanilla deadly traps. UMD is high enough to get a high success rate even with high level scrolls. If you need more ranks for the traps on your PW, you have spare skillpoints to use. You have a lot of spare skill points, so feel free to pick other skills you may want.
I picked a +2 int gift to improve the DA DC and that also provides extra skillpoints.
Tweaks:
If you want +1 AB, +1 AC and +2 DA DC, you can trade the last 2 levels of rogue for 2 assassin Levels. You will lose epic dodge, but can take 2 great dex instead of epic dodge and blind fight.
You can build with elf rather than halfling. You get  big enough size to dual wield shortswords , but the AB will suffer -1 (medium size) and you will lose the racial bonus to stealth.

Here's a completely different approach. This build has both advantages and disadvantages compared to Nick Dagger's build: +1 AB, +1 attacks per round, +6 damage (WS/EWS), +2 AC, Knockdown, Crippling Strike, much earlier Blind Fight, but the loss of Death Attack and -1D6 damage on sneak attacks. The build is inside the spoiler.

The higher your Set Trap skill, the higher the DC of the traps you set, so I maximized Set Traps. The same applies for the traps set by enemy PCs, so I also maximized Disable Trap and Search. Assuming that you get at least +2 DEX from gear, you should be able to disable all standard epic traps, and recover all deadly or lower traps. The UMD should enable you to use all scrolls without failure except for level 8, which will fail occasionally.
